headline: Phyllis’s Braised Collard Greens
name: Phyllis’s Braised Collard Greens
description: Phyllis's braised collard greens, cooked low and slow with ham hocks, are meltingly tender and delicious.
recipeIngredient: 3 lbs collard greens, cleaned, stems removed, cut into ½-inch strips
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place smoked ham hocks in a large pot and add 4 cups of water. Cover and simmer over low heat until meat nearly pulls away from the bone, and the skin is a little tender, about 1 hour.
Remove ham hocks from the pot. Add collards and red pepper flakes, and season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer until tender, about 1 hour. Add ham hocks back in and cook for another 15 minutes.
